title: Zen
author: Adam
teaser: It's amazing how much pain can simply be exhaled...
content: It’s awesome how much pain can simply be exhaled along with any spectre of You being the centre of this universe. And because you care less about a thing if you’re no longer at the centre of it, You can start living and stop worrying about not living and all the other shit.

title: Cookies
author: Adam
teaser: To find a spare kitchen in the mind...
content:
To find a spare kitchen in the mind,  
a spare cupboard – or a cookie jar  
for the sugar rush of sound

whirls of vowels caking into rhyme  
rhythm to toss them in and out of time  
drizzles of doubt to rain onto it all

a nook for nuggets  
a crevice for crumbs  
a cranny for the cookies

to feed inside that something  
that all the worldly yummies  
leave forever wanting

title: Let it be
author: Eve
teaser: you don’t have to will it into existence...
content: you don’t have to will it into existence. just stop running from the chance that it might already be there.

title: A day in England
author: Adam
teaser: An award-winning postal worker went to shop...
content:
An award-winning postal worker  
went to shop – but not to any shop  
An award-winning pencil retailer  
selling award-winning stock.  
He picked up his prize-winning pet  
at the award-winning pet hotel  
and picked award-winning dog shit  
on the way to his award-winning hovel  
in a multi-award-winning development  
next to the acclaimed motorway  
Then watched award-winning adult content  
on his freshly-awarded holiday.

One million new awards were given away  
elsewhere in England, that jolly dandy day.

title: freedom
author: Adam
teaser: in the sphere of all-out freedom, freedom becomes unthinkable...
content:
In the sphere of all-out freedom  
Freedom becomes unthinkable  
We’re no longer distinguishable  
There’s nothing to break free from

title: Where TV goes to die
author: Adam Farkas
teaser: It's usually in Season Thee that a series becomes The Slope.
content: It’s usually in Season Three That a series becomes The Slope. Busted killer ain’t the real deal Superkiller’s still at large His MO is much-much sicker His chainsaw is much-much bigger Lone detective’s life still sucks You bet it will even more But the plot now smells like beer you’ve drunk and flushed before Millennial dudes appear (Cop’s daughter is now sixteen she befriends the killer’s son to make out and get in a ton of shit of no significance) Every other scene it seems has flashes of the suspect’s dreams of absurd childhood trauma by punk-ass, rotten, wretched dad Killer’s jacking off in shed with victim’s bloody finger-puppets smiling from his nightstand While AA-skipping cop is sneaking through the fog in Iceland (or Finland? Cleveland? Ealing?) Can’t be arsed to ask for backup however long he’s been suspended however loud they let’s-saddle-up (He knows the other cops are crooks, save the rookie girl who found that Jane Doe in the woods) Loved you to bits Season One I put up with you Season Two Season Three, I’ll kill you. And then I’ll binge on Breaking Bad again.
